Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fluorescence Angiography in Colorectal Surgery

Intervention.evidence: Eligible studies compared fluorescence angiography with standard care.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of fluorescence angiography on anastomotic leak and postoperative morbidity.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of anastomotic leak, measured within 30 to 90 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Fluorescence angiography significantly reduced anastomotic leak rates with an odds ratio of 0.64 (95% CI: 0.39–0.98, p < 0.0001)
